page.title: 04INTERESTING BUILDINGS
page.content: {THE OLD HALL__ }This building is undated except by some early seventeenth century features. It is built of Limestone with Sandstone used for good moulded doorway mullions, string courses, kneelers, gable coping and finial. Tradition speaks of an East Wing which is now South View Farm.This has good coursed sandstone walls and has a Welsh slate roof. {KIRKBANK HOUSE__ }This was once the home of curate William Kirkbank who died in 1842 at the age of 90.It is built of Limestone it features unusual brick chimneys and good eighteenth century windows. {THE CROSS KEYS INN__ }This was built by David Yeadon on land allotted in 1770.This and the adjoining terrace, though well matched,show four distinct phases of building. {_
